intro: Ononis adglutinans, commonly known as stickyweed or sticky ononis, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and covered with fine, sticky hairs, which give the plant its common name. Ononis adglutinans thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in wastelands, roadsides, and disturbed areas.
